metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the unix-def:runlevel_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the unix-def:runlevel_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity equal to some value and a runlevel entity equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity not equal to some value and a runlevel entity equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity matching some regular expression and a runlevel entity equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity equal to some value and a runlevel entity not equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity equal to some value and a runlevel entity that matches some regular expression.

runlevel_test.comment: Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity equal to some value and a runlevel entity equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity not equal to some value and a runlevel entity equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity matching some regular expression and a runlevel entity equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity equal to some value and a runlevel entity not equal to some value.
Test that the runlevel_object is supported with the service_name entity equal to some value and a runlevel entity that matches some regular expression.

runlevel_object.comment: Retrieve a runlevel_item with a service_name equal to 'sshd' and a runlevel equal to '3'.
Retrieve runlevel_items with service_names that are not equal to 'sshd' and a runlevel equal to '3'.
Retrieve runlevel_items with service_names that match the regular expression '^ss.d$' and a runlevel that equals '3'.
Retrieve runlevel_items with service_name equal to 'sshd' and a runlevel not equal to '0'.
Retrieve runlevel_items with a service_name equal to 'sshd' and a runlevel that matches the regular expression '^[0-6sS]$'.

runlevel_state.comment: This state represents an runlevel_item that has a service_name equal to 'sshd' and a runlevel equal to '3'.
This state represents runlevel_items that have a service_name not equal to 'sshd' and a runlevel equal to '3'.
This state represents runlevel_items that have a service_name that matches the regular expression '^ss.d$' and a runlevel equal to '3'.
This state represents runlevel_items that have a service_name not equal to 'sshd' and a runlevel not equal to '0'.
This state represents runlevel_items that have a service_name that matches the regular expression 'sshd' and a runlevel that matches the regular expression '^[0-6sS]$'.
